a.title: Search
a.style: color: white; font-family: Verdana; text-decoration: none;

p.span: The District No. 95 community strives to provide optimal educational opportunities for all of our children. It is our mission to prepare our students to become confident, self-assured, life-long learners. It is our goal to ensure their success as citizens of the world.

span.p: As you may be aware, the Governor has ordered Remote Learning the rest of this school year. I can imagine that this news may cause concern and for sure will generate lots of questions. I want to share a few pieces of information as well as a few thoughts.

p.b: To read the full letter click the header above.

a.title: Click to read more about: April 17 Parent Update

span.p: As you are aware, the Governor has issued schools to provide remote learning at least until April 30. We continue to work through our plan to meet the needs of the students. On a positive note, I wanted to share some very positive D95 news. The District 95 school community will utilize the new SEG STEAM LAB to begin developing face shields for first responders. We will use our laser cutter to begin making face shields from plexiglass and 3D printers to create the holders for the face shields. Many staff members have volunteered to assemble these masks. They will be donated to local organizations that are in desperate need of this protective equipment.
On Monday, April 6 we will move into our Phase 2 of Remote Learning. You will be alerted by your student’s school as to how to access the new learning materials on Sunday.

p.b: To read the full letter click the header above.

a.title: Click to read more about: April 3 Parent Update

span.strong: Brookfield-La Grange Park School District 95 has a vacancy on its School Board due to the recent resignation of an existing board member.

span.p: The Board is accepting letters of interest until May 1, 2020. Letters typically include a short summary of why you have an interest in serving on the board coupled with any special skills you believe may help the Board with conducting its work.
In order to serve on the Board, you must be a resident of District 95 and at least 18 years of age. The appointed person will serve until April, 2021 at which time they will have the choice to:

ol.li: No longer serve as a Board Member

span.p: The Board is accepting letters of interest until May 1, 2020. Letters may be addressed to the Board of Education at 3724 Prairie Avenue, Brookfield, IL 60513. Anyone with questions about the position is encouraged to contact the District Superintendent at 708-588-8701 or via email at mkuzniewski@district95.org.
